summary: The document is a journal entry from the Office of Legislative Counsel dated 30 March 1977, detailing various liaison activities. These include handling a constituent's request for information on the Kennedy assassination under the FOIA, coordinating speaking engagements for Anne Karalekas of the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence, inquiring about the publication of Subcommittee hearings on African Affairs, and fulfilling a request from Senator Jacob K. Javits' office for a study on climatological research.
key_findings: The document highlights the process of handling FOIA requests related to the Kennedy assassination.
It shows the coordination between different governmental offices for speaking engagements and information sharing.
The entry provides insight into the types of requests and information exchanges between legislative offices and their constituents or other government entities.
keywords: Senate Foreign Relations Subcommittee on African Affairs
